perturbation.original_text: (b) All amounts owed to Agent hereunder are due within thirty (30) days of the invoice date. Delinquent payments are subject to a late payment charge of one and one half percent (1.5%) per month commencing sixty (60) days from the invoice date. Client agrees to reimburse Agent for any attorney's fees and any other costs associated with collecting delinquent payments.
perturbation.changed_text: (b) All amounts owed to Agent hereunder are due within thirty (30) days of the invoice date. Delinquent payments are subject to a late payment charge of one and one half percent (1.5%) per month commencing forty-five (45) days from the invoice date. Client agrees to reimburse Agent for any attorney's fees and any other costs associated with collecting delinquent payments.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract states that late payment charges commence 60 days from the invoice date. This has been changed to 45 days from the invoice date. This creates an in-text contradiction, introducing uncertainty as to when late payment fees are actually applied, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: (c) Upon termination of this Agreement, all fees earned and expenses incurred by Agent up to and including the date of such termination shall be immediately due and payable to Agent on or before the effective date of such termination.
perturbation.changed_text: (c) Upon termination of this Agreement, all fees earned and expenses incurred by Agent up to and including the date of such termination shall be due and payable to Agent within 30 days of the effective date of such termination.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract specifies immediate payment of fees upon termination. The changed contract specifies payment within 30 days of the effective date of termination. This discrepancy creates uncertainty about the payment deadline, which generates potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: (b) Agent may suspend providing services hereunder or terminate this Agreement if (i) Client fails to pay amounts due hereunder or defaults on any of its material obligations hereunder and such failure or default remains uncured thirty (30) days after Client's receipt of notice of such failure or default from Agent
perturbation.changed_text: (b) Agent may suspend providing services hereunder or terminate this Agreement if (i) Client fails to pay amounts due hereunder or defaults on any of its material obligations hereunder and such failure or default remains uncured forty-five (45) days after Client's receipt of notice of such failure or default from Agent
perturbation.explanation: In the original text, the client has 30 days after receiving notice to cure a payment default, while the modified text extends this period to 45 days. This contradiction undermines the clarity of the contract and could spark disagreements about termination rights.
